meanings.definition: To estimate too highly; to overvalue or overrate.
meanings.sent1: She keeps overestimating her abilities and ends up disappointed.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overestimate how long it will take to finish a project.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was overestimating its jumping skills and missed the branch.
meanings.sent4: Don't overestimate the power of a single smile to brighten someone's day.
meanings.sent5: The magician was overestimating the audience's ability to guess his trick.

meanings.definition: To make an estimate that is too high; to overrate.
meanings.sent1: They are overestimating the cost of the repairs; it won't be that expensive.
meanings.sent2: Stop overestimating how much time we have left before the meeting starts.
meanings.sent3: The cat was overestimating the value of the empty box as a hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been overestimating the importance of social media likes.
meanings.sent5: The coach warned the team against overestimating the opponent's skills.
